STEP 1: Go to https://portal.company.com/reset
STEP 2: Enter your work email
STEP 3: Check your inbox for the reset link (check spam folder)
STEP 4: Click the link and create a new password

Password Requirements:
- At least 8 characters
- 1 uppercase letter
- 1 number
- 1 special character (!@#$%)

If you still can't reset, contact IT at ext. 5500

VPN CONNECTION STEPS:

STEP 1: Download Cisco AnyConnect from IT Portal
STEP 2: Install and open the application
STEP 3: Server address: vpn.company.com
STEP 4: Username: Your AD username
STEP 5: Password: Your regular login password

TROUBLESHOOTING:
- Ensure you're connected to internet
- Check if firewall allows port 443
- Try disconnecting and reconnecting
- Restart your computer

Still not working? Call IT: ext. 5500

PRINTER TROUBLESHOOTING:

STEP 1: Check if printer is powered on and has paper
STEP 2: Open Control Panel > Devices and Printers
STEP 3: Right-click your printer > 'See what's printing'
STEP 4: Click 'Printer' menu > 'Cancel All Documents'
STEP 5: Restart Print Spooler:
   - Press Win+R
   - Type 'services.msc'
   - Find 'Print Spooler'
   - Right-click > Restart

STEP 6: If still not working, remove and re-add printer from IT Portal

Need help? IT ext. 5500

EMAIL NOT SYNCING FIX:

STEP 1: Check your internet connection
STEP 2: Close and reopen Outlook
STEP 3: Verify your credentials:
   - File > Account Settings > Account Settings
   - Select your account > Change
   - Re-enter password

STEP 4: Clear Outlook cache:
   - Close Outlook
   - Delete files in: C:\Users\YourName\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Outlook

STEP 5: Restart computer

STEP 6: If still failing, recreate email profile:
   - Control Panel > Mail > Show Profiles > Add

Contact IT if needed: ext. 5500

SLOW COMPUTER SOLUTIONS:

IMMEDIATE FIXES:
STEP 1: Close unused programs and browser tabs
STEP 2: Press Ctrl+Shift+Esc to open Task Manager
STEP 3: Check which programs use high CPU/Memory
STEP 4: Right-click and 'End Task' on unnecessary programs

CLEANUP:
STEP 5: Delete temporary files:
   - Press Win+R
   - Type '%temp%' and press Enter
   - Select all (Ctrl+A) and delete

STEP 6: Restart your computer

STEP 7: Run Windows Disk Cleanup:
   - Search 'Disk Cleanup' in Start menu
   - Select C: drive
   - Check all boxes and click OK

If still slow after 24 hours, contact IT: ext. 5500

INTERNET CONNECTION ISSUES:

STEP 1: Check if Wi-Fi is turned on
STEP 2: Disconnect and reconnect to Wi-Fi network
STEP 3: Restart your router:
   - Unplug power cable
   - Wait 30 seconds
   - Plug back in
   - Wait 2 minutes for full restart

STEP 4: Reset network settings:
   - Open Command Prompt as Administrator
   - Type: ipconfig /release
   - Type: ipconfig /renew
   - Type: ipconfig /flushdns

STEP 5: Restart computer

Network still down? IT: ext. 5500

SOFTWARE INSTALLATION:

APPROVED SOFTWARE:
STEP 1: Go to IT Self-Service Portal
STEP 2: Browse 'Software Catalog'
STEP 3: Select software you need
STEP 4: Click 'Request Install'
STEP 5: Wait for automatic installation (10-30 mins)

CUSTOM SOFTWARE:
If you need software not in catalog:
STEP 1: Submit ticket with software name and business justification
STEP 2: Wait for manager approval
STEP 3: IT will install after security review (2-5 days)

Urgent install? Call IT: ext. 5500

MONITOR/DISPLAY ISSUES:

BLANK SCREEN:
STEP 1: Check monitor power cable is plugged in
STEP 2: Check video cable (HDMI/DisplayPort) connection
STEP 3: Try different video cable if available
STEP 4: Press Windows key + P, select 'Duplicate' or 'Extend'

WRONG RESOLUTION:
STEP 1: Right-click desktop > Display Settings
STEP 2: Scroll to 'Display resolution'
STEP 3: Select recommended resolution

MULTIPLE MONITORS:
STEP 1: Windows key + P
STEP 2: Select 'Extend' for dual monitors

Hardware issue? IT: ext. 5500
